Constructor Detail

BinarySearch

public BinarySearch(SearchFilterIF filter)
Constructs a new BinarySearch object with the specified filter. The filter is used to locate the object in the collection matching the criteria as defined by the filter. Note, that the BinarySearch class assumes that the elements of the set are ordered. If not, the results of the search are undetermined.
Parameters:
filter:Ljjb.toolbox.util.SearchFilterIF - used to determine set membership of the objects in the collection matching the search criteria.
Method Detail

binarySearch

public java.lang.Object binarySearch(Searchable collection,
                                     int startIndex,
                                     int endIndex)
binarySearch performs binary search against a collection of objects that are Searchable. It is assumed that the collection of objects are presorted when this method is called.
Parameters:
collection:Ljjb.toolbox.land.Searchable - object in which to search, and that implements the Searchable interface.
startIndex - is an integer value specifying the beginning index into the data structure to begin the search.
endIndex - is an integer value specifying the end index into the date structure to stop searching for the desired object.
Returns:
a Ljava.lang.Object representing the found element in the collection or null if the element is not found.
See Also:
search

search

public java.lang.Object search(Searchable collection)
search is the default method to invoke the binary searh operation. It uses the default begin and end indexes into the data structure.
Specified by:
search in interface SearcherIF
Parameters:
collection:Ljjb.toolbox.land.Searchable - object in which to search, and that implements the Searchable interface.
Returns:
a Ljava.lang.Object representing the found element in the collection or null if the element is not found.
See Also:
binarySearch
